Description: Sherd of East Greek (North Ionian) Late Wild Goat (black-figured) pottery plate (or lid?); orange clay with some silver mica; cream slip, brownish paint; part of a griffin and of a goose in an antithetical composition; filling ornaments: rosettes with scant incision; details of griffin and of goose incised; glazed to outside of frieze.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.576)
